programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team head for Haltwhistle in Northumberland. Amongst the discoveries made are original fittings from the Titanic's sister ship, the Olympic, a roman coin, and a letter from JRR Tolkein.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the experts are in England, Woburn Abbey in Bedfordshire. Treasured items brought to light include a rare washing bowl for beards, a portrait of a handsome cat valued at 18,000 pounds, and a Victorian bracelet that imitates a snake.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The Antiques Roadshow team head for the seaside. In Hastings, the treasures uncovered are a Meissan pot, a sketch by artist Augustus John, and an unopened wedding gift from the 1920s.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team visits Witley Court in Worcestershire where they discover the complete cast of an early puppet theatre, a Worcester plate, a drawing by LS Lowry, and a piece of Staffordshire slipware.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team head for the Magna Centre in Rotherham. Amongst the items brought to light are a rare clock given by Queen Victoria, a stash of silver, and some Beatles memorabilia.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel explores priceless documents, from the Domesday book to the SOS telegram sent from the Titanic and some early papers charting the work of the suffragettes.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team head for Hampton Court Palace to uncover more family heirlooms. Among the cherished valuables are a bronze figure by Auguste Rodin and an early long case clock.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: A visit to Hampton Court reveals more fascinating finds for the experts. Among those viewed are a coral bracelet, a rare black wax doll, a dress designed by Vivienne Westwood and a small silver pig.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team takes the Roadshow to Hornsea on the Yorkshire coast. There they find a chastity belt dug up on a farm and an 1875 sewing machine still in use today.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Finds include an 18th Century court dress, a diamond, pearl and ruby brooch, a gift given from the Queen Mother to her Head Chef, and a tin cup that turns out to be a rare piece of silver.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK Detectives
programme.desc: Paul Atterbury investigates the mystery that surrounds a portrait of Tina Strobos, a member of the Dutch resistance during the 2nd World War.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel hosts a long overdue visit to Edinburgh where, amongst the treasures, the team find an ornate Russian cigarette case and a lock of Beethoven's hair.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Included in the day's finds are a hoard of 200 typewriters, a suffragette doll dressed in clothes cut from women protestors prison uniforms, a ring worn by the daughter of Charles I.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team head for Cardiff. Amongst the treasures they discover a painting bought at a bootsale, a rare Prince of Wales tea caddy, and a dusty clock brought down from the attic.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Amongst the items featured are an African witch doctor's ceremonial stick, a school boys exercise book from 1745 and a Scandinavian drinking tankard.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Amongst the finds are a letter from Florence Nightingale, the racing silk of a famous jockey, a collection of old wedding photographs, and an Art Deco diamond brooch found in wartime London.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Amongst the finds are a machine gun from World War One, a papal portrait rescued from the bottom of a river and a set of rare maps recording the early settlement of America.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Amongst the treasures brought for valuation are an elegant grape holder made from silver, a cabinet of rare microscope slides and a ruby and diamond brooch.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The Roadshow visits the Outer Hebrides. Amongst the items brought to light are some gruesome medical instruments and a table made from shipwreck salvage.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the Antiques Roadshow team are presented with an Art Deco cigarette case, a 'shock therapy machine', and an ornate pedestal that had been abandoned in a garage.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel marks the 200th anniversary of the Battle of Trafalgar. Among the finds are ornately decorated ostrich eggs and a box made out of debris taken from the vessel.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team head to Abergavenny in Wales where a strange coincidence unites two Beatles collectors. Amongst the other items brought to light are exquisitley carved whalebone and a macabre pottery model.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Amongst the items viewed are a collection of pre-historic spear heads, an early American flag, a highly valuable silver tankard and a pair of spectacles worn by Napoleon.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team visit Dartington Hall near Totnes in Devon to unearth more treasure. They examine a set of royal cufflinks, a letter from Admiral Nelson and a valuable collection of silver.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: A return visit to Dartington finds Michael Aspel and the team with another busy day of finds. Objects under scrutiny include a French cabinet with royal connections.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Ever wondered what happens when the Antiques Roadshow rolls out of town? In this special edition, Michael Aspel traces what has happened to some of the star items from the show.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team are at Lichfield Cathedral in the Midlands. Amongst the items are a small statue thought to be from the tomb of Tutankhamun, an early Punch and Judy set and a sword pistol.
